product_features.label: PF-ACT-1.1
product_features.name: Operate around/ regular interactions with typical actors (baseline)
product_features.details:
* Nominal behaviour
* Road vehicles
  ** Cars
  ** Pickup trucks
* Large vehicles
  ** Buses
  ** Vans
  ** Non-articulated trucks
* VRUs
  ** Bicycles
  ** Pedestrians
  ** Other
    *** NONE

product_features.label: PF-ACT-2.1
product_features.name: Articulated vehicles: operate around/ regular interactions (baseline)
product_features.details: * Nominal behaviour

product_features.label: PF-ACT-3.1
product_features.name: Mobile CHE vehicles: operate around/ regular interactions (baseline)
product_features.details:
* Nominal behaviour
* Types:
  ** Reach stacker
  ** Empty handler

product_features.label: PF-CE-1.1
product_features.name: CE: Driver in, supervised operations
product_features.details:
* Supervised operation
  ** SDIC interfaces is defined by Terberg-1
  ** Protective stops as implemented by Terberg-1
  ** Terberg-1 safety envelope defined by Terberg-1
* Oxa RAD
  ** Incl HW integration compliance with Terberg-1 guidelines
  ** Incl SW integration compliance with Terberg-1 guidelines
* NO additional Oxa SW components

product_features.label: PF-CE-1.2
product_features.name: CE: Driver out, supervised operations
product_features.details:
* External operator (VLOS)
  ** Requirements on FORT controller and comms (eg latency, loss of comms), and integration with Terberg-1 HW/ SW (via FORT EPC into Terberg-1 SAFE_STOP)
* Remote operator (bVLOS)
  ** Requirements on RO controller and comms (eg latency, loss of comms), and integration with Terberg-1 HW/ SW (via FORT EPC into Terberg-1 SAFE_STOP)
  ** Comms requirements from AV to RO station (ie keep the teleop system separate from THIS CE marking ie we can then buy or build systems that satisfy these requirements.

product_features.label: PF-CE-1.3
product_features.name: CE: Driver out, constrained steering limits
product_features.details:
* Add Oxa Steering Rate limits on PL-d rated ECU
  ** This will reduce the required lateral clearance, thereby unlocking more operational domains

product_features.label: PF-CE-1.4
product_features.name: CE: Baseline port ODD and environmental conditions
product_features.details:
* Add baseline ODD and Environmental Conditions
* NOTE: Mostly SP (vs PP)

product_features.label: PF-ENV-1.1
product_features.name: Handle baseline environmental conditions
product_features.details:
* Ambient Temp: 
  ** Min: 0C
  ** Max: 50C
* Sand/ Dust: Light
  ** Visibility: >100m
  ** Precipitation: N/A
  ** Accumulation: N/A
* Illumination: 
  ** Day time
  ** Dusk/ Dawn
  ** Night time, but illuninated (>12 lux)
* Rain
  ** Precipitation rate: Moderate (<7 mm/hr)
  ** Visibility: >100m
  ** Accumulation: N/A
* Wind: <30mph (?)
* Fog/ smoke: Light
  ** Visibility: >100m
* Snow: 
  ** Precipitation: None
  ** Visibility: N/A
  ** Accumulation: N/A
* Ground cover: Dry, Wet

product_features.label: PF-INF-7.1
product_features.name: Avoid (ie drive around) static objects in lane: baseline
product_features.details:
* Low objects
  ** >20cm height
* Street Furniture
  ** Cones > 20cm
  ** Curbs > 10cm
  ** Barriers >10cm

product_features.label: PF-INF-8.1
product_features.name: Straddle low static objects in lane: baseline
product_features.details: NONE
product_features.comments:
LPO:  Why would we ever have an ability to avoid objects but not ones that straddle our lane?  It shouldn't be a separate capability, at either the product level, nor the tech level.  That's just setting the bar too low.
Noel: It's not the obstacle that straddles the lane, but a small object which the AV needs to straddle (vs drive around)

product_features.label: PF-INF-9.1
product_features.name: Handle inclines: baseline
product_features.details:
* Inclines
  ** < 5% grade
* Surface
  ** Wet/ Dry asphalt

product_features.label: PF-OPS-1.1
product_features.name: AV System duty cycle management (baseline)
product_features.details:
* Service: Automatic service activation / deactivation (based on time, schedule, system status meeting criteria for planned service hours when the AV will automatically commence jobs it is aware of)
* Veh Admin: Remote boot and mode control
* Veh Admin: Automatic autonomy authorisation (based on estops, system health/battery, maintenance record, allowed hours, ODD conditions, scheduled downtime)
* Mission: Automatic retire to home
* Mission: Automatic retire for refueling

product_features.label: PF-OPS-2-1
product_features.name: Remote Vehicle Management (baseline)
product_features.details:
* Remote restarting of ACS services and devices
* Remote modification of vehicle config and env config
* Remote software updates
* Remote calibration management
* Performance metric viewer and short term history traces.

product_features.label: PF-OPS-3-1
product_features.name: Remote Data Management (baseline)
product_features.details:
* Live telemetry state available and viewable
* Automatic processing of HD data snippets
* Automatic upload management (concurrent, end-of-shift)
* Cloud access to data snippets
* Remote request to record HD Data

product_features.label: PF-OPS-4.1
product_features.name: Fleet Management (baseline)
product_features.details: * Continuous service, while hot-swapping vehicles

capabilities.label: CA-SV-3.1
capabilities.name: M2 Remote Selection: AV presents the RO with a set of discrete actions to select.

capabilities.label: CA-SV-4.1
capabilities.name: M3 Remote Guidance: RO provides guidance in the form of a Corridor to unstick the AV, and the AV plans and execute the action while avoiding obstacles

capabilities.label: CA-SV-5.1
capabilities.name: M4/M5 Remote Driving / Control: Teleoperation (<300ms latency), selective forwarding, to N remote operation stations (with single-user authorisation)

capabilities.label: CA-SV-5.2
capabilities.name: M4/M5 Remote Driving / Control: Low-latency (<200ms) teleoperation to a single, on-site remote operation station (peer-to-peer) and live monitoring to N remote operation states (selective forwarding)

capabilities.label: CA-SV-6.1
capabilities.name: HUB can set the trailer configuration (eg attached, number of trailers, etc)

capabilities.label: CA-SV-7.1
capabilities.name: Remote Operator can confirm and signal that the CHE interaction task is complete

capabilities.label: CA-TBA-1.1
capabilities.name: Something about launching (start of day)

capabilities.label: CA-TBA-1.2
capabilities.name: Something about dynamic mission management, for example for battery charge/ fueling

capabilities.label: CA-TBA-1.3
capabilities.name: Something about remote access/ debugging

capabilities.label: CA-TBA-1.4
capabilities.name: Something about OTA SW updates

capabilities.label: CA-TBA-1.5
capabilities.name: Something about remote Calibration and configuration management

capabilities.label: CA-VEH-1.1
capabilities.name: Vehicle Interface: Extend LUT functionality to compensate for vehicle-vehicle differences and load conditions

capabilities.label: CA-VEH-1.2
capabilities.name: Vehicle Interface: 5th wheel height control task executor

capabilities.label: CA-VEH-2.1
capabilities.name: HMI: Internal Operator can confirm CHE rendevouz task complete

technical_functions.label: TF-PRC-1.0
technical_functions.name: Reach Stacker Sim2Real Synthetic Data Generation (500k samples)

technical_functions.label: TF-PRC-1.1
technical_functions.name: Reach Stacker Object Classification in BEV Fusion (MultiBody)

technical_functions.label: TF-PRC-1.2
technical_functions.name: SplineTracker Updated to Track ReachStacker (Account for Multibody Forks)

technical_functions.label: TF-PRC-1.3
technical_functions.name: Synthetic Generation of Reach Stacker Scenarios for ML Planner Training

technical_functions.label: TF-PRC-1.5
technical_functions.name: Simulated Validation on +100 Reach Staker Scenarios with EMT KPIs
